--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "Hesam" <hesi21@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Bert;
> =
I would really appreciated your comment. But i am confused. I don't 
> know=
 whether i should install source file through VC++.Net? There i 
> several =
files at "Cantera\fortran\src"! which file shall i deal with 
> and how? I =
would be very very thankful if anybody could give me a 
step 
> by step pro=
cedure!
> Regards,
> Hesam
>
Hi Hesam,

I use Visual Studio .NET 2003 and t=
he Intel Fortran compiler 9.1.  I 
just finished a project where my colleag=
ue was still using DEC Fortran 
5.0.  This caused a problem.  I could not s=
end him .lib files because 
Microsoft has changed the library file format. =
 THe older linker that 
comes with the DEC compiler could not understand th=
e new format.  So if 
you are trying to use VC++ .NET and Compaq Fortran 6.=
X you will not be 
able to link your Fortran application.  I was able to ge=
t around this 
problem by doing all the reaction kinetics coding in C++, cr=
eating a 
DLL that exposed a few functions to Fortran and building a .lib f=
ile 
for DEC Fortran from a manually created .DEF file.  However here is a =

more detailed procedure if you have a .NET compatible Fortran compiler.

U=
npack the source files.  
In Visual Studio (C++) .NET
Create a new solution=
.  I put it in the win32/vc7 directory and named 
it ct_fortran.
Add a new =
project to the solution for the C/C++ files (I called mine 
ct_forc), C++, =
Win32 project.  Under application settings select Static 
library and desel=
ect precompiled header option.  The C/C++ runtime 
libraries should be chan=
ged to Multithread DLL.  Setup the include 
paths for your Cantera version.=
  I'm using 1.7.1 so they 
were '../../../../Cantera/src/base' etc.  Add th=
e cpp file as source 
modules and the h as headers to the project and build=
.

For the Fortran files you need another project (.NET does NOT allow you =

to mix languages).  I called this one ct_for.  Add the .f90 code files 
to=
 that project source and build.  

You can then copy the 2 .lib files produ=
ced and the Cantera.mod to the 
library directory from your install.  

Hop=
e this helps
Bert
